metadata.titleEn: Ring-width indices and annual water deficit anomaly of the southwest USA (1902-2012)
metadata.titleCn: 美国西南部年轮宽度指数和年度水分亏缺异常数据（1902-2012）
metadata.description:
This dataset is collected from the  Supplementary Materials part of the paper: Gao, S., Zhou, T., Yi, C., Shi, P., Fang, W., Liu, R., Liang, E., & Julio Camarero, J. (2020). Asymmetric impacts of dryness and wetness on tree growth and forest coverage. Agricultural and Forest Meteorology, 288-289, 107980. doi:10.1016/j.agrformet.2020.107980.
In this paper the researchers took forests in the semi-arid area of the Colorado Plateau in the southwest USA as the research object, comprehensively applied a large amount of tree ring width data, combined with remote sensing forest coverage data, they explored the legacy effect under the influence of the interannual water deficit by designing "natural experiments" at the regional scale, and compared the similarities and differences of the effect of the interannual water status changes on the tree ring width and forest coverage. The study found that the water status in the year when the tree ring was formed can significantly affect the duration and intensity of the legacy effect, and the response of the tree ring width and forest coverage to the interannual water status is different. 
This data contains ring-width indices (RWI) of 357 sample sites in 111-hydrological year (i.e., for 1902–2012) and annual water deficit anomaly (Dya) that matched to RWI.
The tree-ring database used in this research was composed of 357 standard chronologies of three major species (Pinus edulis Engelm., Pinus ponderosa Douglas ex C. Lawson and Pseudotsuga menziesii (Mirb.) Franco) in the study region, spanning from 1902 to 2012, resulting in a total of 29,969 site-years. A total of 357 tree-ring width chronologies of three major tree species were obtained from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/paleoclimatology-data/datasets/tree-ring). To transform tree-ring width data into ring-width indices (RWI), long-term trends caused by aging and increasing trunk diameter were mostly removed by negative exponential curves using the ARSTAN program (Cook, 1985). After performing standardization, all chronologies were scaled to a standard mean (RWI = 1000) with a comparable variance to reduce the spatial heterogeneity among these tree-ring sites.
In this research, researchers used annual water deficit anomaly (Dya) to explore the impact of water deficit variability on tree radial growth and growth legacies. They matched gridded Dya to RWIs. For tree-ring chronologies within the same grid, they averaged them for each year to reduce bias caused by the rough resolution of climate data.
The data is 1 Excel workbooks, Ring-width indices and annual water deficit anomaly (1902-2012), which contains 3 worksheets as follows:
raw_data
processed_data
variables
The data contains the following fields:
sitename: the name of tree-ring sampled site
Year: the tree-ring formation year
RWI: ring-width indices
latitude: the latitude of tree-ring sampled site
lontitude: the lontitude of tree-ring sampled site
altitude: the altitude of tree-ring sampled site
lon Grid no.: the lontitude grid number of tree-ring sampled site
lat Grid no.: the latitude grid number of tree-ring sampled site
Dya_3: water deficit anomaly of the 3rd year before the tree-ring formation year (i.e. "Year" column) 
Dya_2: water deficit anomaly of the 2nd year before the tree-ring formation year (i.e. "Year" column) 
Dya_1: water deficit anomaly of the 1st year before the tree-ring formation year (i.e. "Year" column) 
Dya_curr: water deficit anomaly of the tree-ring formation year (i.e. "Year" column) 
Dya_std: the standard  deviation of 111-hydrological year (i.e., for 1902–2012) averaged annual water deficit of the grid
metadata.descriptionCn:
本数据集来源于论文：Gao, S., Zhou, T., Yi, C., Shi, P., Fang, W., Liu, R., Liang, E., & Julio Camarero, J. (2020). Asymmetric impacts of dryness and wetness on tree growth and forest coverage. Agricultural and Forest Meteorology, 288-289, 107980. doi:10.1016/j.agrformet.2020.107980. 数据提取自论文内Supplementary Materials中的表格数据。
此论文以美国西南部科罗拉多高原半干旱区森林为研究对象，综合应用大量的树轮宽度数据，结合遥感森林覆盖数据，通过在区域尺度设计“自然试验”（natural experiments），探讨了年际水分亏缺叠加影响下的滞后效应，并对比了年际间水分状况变化对树轮宽度和森林盖度影响的异同。研究发现，树轮形成当年的水分状况可显著影响滞后效应的持续时间及强度；树轮宽度与森林盖度对年际间水分状况的响应存在差异。
数据中包含357个采样点，111个水文年（1902-2012年）的年轮宽度指数（RWI）和与之匹配的年度水分亏缺异常（Dya）数据。
研究中使用的年轮数据由研究区域内三个主要物种的357个标准年表组成，时间跨度为1902年至2012年，总共有29,969个站点-年。三个主要物种的357个树年轮宽度年表来自国际树轮数据银行（International Tree-Ring Data Bank，https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/paleoclimatology-data/datasets/tree-ring）。使用ARSTAN程序通过负指数曲线消除了由老化和树干直径增加引起的长期趋势（Cook, 1985），将树木年轮宽度数据转换成了年轮宽度指数（RWI）。进行标准化后，为了减少这些树环站点之间的空间异质性，所有年表均按具有可比方差的标准均值（RWI = 1000）进行了缩放。
研究中使用了年度水分亏缺异常（Dya）来探讨水分亏缺变异性对树木径向生长和生长遗产的影响。将网格化的Dya与RWI进行了匹配，为了减少由于气候数据的粗略解析而引起的偏差，对于同一网格内的树木年轮年表，将它们进行了每年平均。
数据集包含1个Excel数据文件，Ring-width indices and annual water deficit anomaly (1902-2012)
包含三张数据表，数据表名称分别为：
raw_data：原始数据
processed_data：加工后的数据
variables：变量
数据中包含以下字段：
sitename：树木年轮采样点的名称
Year：年轮形成年
RWI：年轮宽度指数
latitude：树木年轮采样点的纬度
lontitude：树木年轮采样点的经度
altitude：树木年轮采样点的高程
lon Grid No .：树木年轮采样点的经度网格号
lat Grid No .：树木年轮采样点的纬度网格号
Dya_3：年轮形成年（即“年”列）前第三年的缺水异常
Dya_2：年轮形成年（即“年”列）前第二年的缺水异常
Dya_1：年轮形成年（即“年”列）前第一年的缺水异常
Dya_curr：年轮形成年（即“年”列）的缺水异常
Dya_std：111个水文年（即1902-2012年）的标准年平均网格缺水量

background: The prevalence of legacy effects, especially in drought-prone forests, makes the accurate assessment of forest dynamics under frequent climate fluctuations challenging. Forest ecosystems are becoming increasingly vulnerable in the face of climate change, especially in semiarid regions. Intensified drought stress, now generally agreed upon as the most widespread and frequent threat to many forests, has led to recent higher tree mortality rate and forest die-off episodes. Although a meteorological water budget can be constantly monitored, its impacts on tree growth and forest dynamics are quite uncertain. One important reason is the pervasive existence of legacies (i.e. the lagged responses to extreme events) in forest ecosystems. Observational research generally revealed 1- to 4-year long legacies recorded in tree-rings at regional to global scales and presented the recovery process of tree growth after droughts. Similarly, the enhancement of radial growth after extreme wetness could also be observed for 1 to 5 years. So far, most related studies focused on lagged impacts of past extreme years or events on current growth; however, current water condition immediately influence current growth, which may alter or offset the ecological impacts of past extremes. In addition, despite the abundance of evidence on the significant legacy effects recorded in tree-rings, whether these growth legacies could be upscaled to the level of a whole forest have not been fully discussed.
research objective: In this study, we (1) examined the temporal dynamics of legacy effects recorded in tree-rings with the consideration of both past and current water deficit conditions, and (2) compared legacy effects on both tree-ring widths and forest coverage change to expand our understanding of forest dynamics in response to climate from both spatial scales. We hypothesized that the temporal pattern of legacy effect changes when effects from multiple years are superimposed on top of one another. We also hypothesized that the response of tree growth to the shift of interannual water deficit condition is rapid and intense, but forest coverage does not have obvious changes in a short period.
challenges: The representativeness of tree-ring data in the ITRDB has been questioned: some studies pointed out that tree-ring data in the ITRDB significantly overestimate regional forest climate sensitivity due to the specific selection of sampling sites. Updating more metadata (e.g., diameter at breast height, microenvironment information) of sampled trees in the ITRDB can help to clarify these uncertainties.
methods: We designed a series of regional-scaled “natural experiments”, specifically, we preset hypothetical water conditions of current- and antecedent-hydrological years and conducted quantitative analysis on grouped tree-ring records and sub-pixel changes of forest coverage under these conditions. We used FCC data to further study the impacts of inter-annual water deficit on forest coverage dynamics. We first set selection criteria (normal, wet or dry) to water deficit conditions of the current and its previous year, and then grouped FCC data according to those criteria so analysis could be conducted among those groups.
dataset: A total of 357 tree-ring width chronologies of three major tree species (Pinus edulis Engelm., Pinus ponderosa Douglas ex C. Lawson and Pseudotsuga menziesii (Mirb.) Franco) were obtained from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank. The study region contained 3388 PFPs, spanning from 2002 to 2017, resulting in a total of 54,208 FCC data.
findings: Results showed that the temporal patterns of growth legacy changed dynamically when studying it on multiple events level (i.e., both past and current climate condition are taken into consideration): under current-hydrological year dry conditions, legacy effects over 3 years could be detected; while under current-hydrological year wet conditions, only previous 1 year's legacy could be detected, and its intensity was only 57% of that under current-hydrological year dry conditions. Furthermore, our results revealed that growth dynamics observed in tree rings were not fully consistent with the dynamic of forest coverage. Wetness enhanced growth pronouncedly, whereas normal to wet conditions only barely maintained the stability of forest coverage, suggesting that tree growth is more sensitive to wetness than forest coverage. In addition, the impact of consecutive dry years on tree radial growth showed no significant difference from that of a single dry year, but the decline of forest coverage accelerated after consecutive droughts.
backgroundCn: 遗留效应的普遍存在，尤其是在干旱易发的森林中，使得在频繁气候波动下准确评估森林动态变得具有挑战性。面对气候变化，森林生态系统变得越来越脆弱，尤其是在半干旱地区。加剧的干旱压力，现在普遍被认为是许多森林面临的最广泛和频繁的威胁，导致近期树木死亡率上升和森林枯死事件的发生。尽管气象水文预算可以持续监测，但其对树木生长和森林动态的影响却相当不确定。一个重要原因是森林生态系统中普遍存在的遗留效应（即对极端事件的滞后反应）。观察性研究通常揭示了在区域到全球范围内，树轮中记录的1到4年的遗留效应，并展示了树木在干旱后的恢复过程。同样，极端湿润后的径向生长增强也可以观察到，持续时间为1到5年。迄今为止，大多数相关研究集中在过去极端年份或事件对当前生长的滞后影响上；然而，当前的水文条件会立即影响当前的生长，这可能会改变或抵消过去极端事件的生态影响。此外，尽管有大量证据表明树轮中记录了显著的遗留效应，但这些生长遗留效应是否能够上升到整个森林的层面尚未得到充分讨论。
research objectiveCn: 在本研究中，我们 (1) 考察了树轮中记录的遗留效应的时间动态，同时考虑了过去和当前的水分不足条件，以及 (2) 比较了树轮宽度和森林覆盖变化的遗留效应，以扩展我们对森林在气候响应下的动态理解，涵盖两个空间尺度。我们假设，当多年的影响叠加在一起时，遗留效应的时间模式会发生变化。我们还假设，树木生长对年际水分不足条件变化的响应是快速而强烈的，但森林覆盖在短期内没有明显变化。
challengesCn: 国际树轮数据库（ITRDB）中的树轮数据的代表性受到质疑：一些研究指出，ITRDB中的树轮数据显著高估了区域森林气候敏感性，这主要是由于采样地点的特定选择。更新更多的元数据（例如，胸径、微环境信息）可以帮助澄清这些不确定性。
methodsCn: 我们设计了一系列区域尺度的“自然实验”，具体来说，我们预设了当前和前一个水文年的假设水条件，并对分组的树轮记录和森林覆盖的亚像素变化进行了定量分析。我们使用FCC数据进一步研究了年际水分不足对森林覆盖动态的影响。我们首先设定了选择标准（正常、湿润或干燥）来划分当前及其前一年水分不足的条件，然后根据这些标准对FCC数据进行了分组，以便在这些组之间进行分析。
datasetCn: 从国际树轮数据银行获得了357个树轮宽度年表，涉及三种主要树种（Pinus edulis Engelm.、Pinus ponderosa Douglas ex C. Lawson和Pseudotsuga menziesii (Mirb.) Franco）。研究区域包含3388个PFP，时间跨度为2002年至2017年，总共获得了54,208个FCC数据。
findingsCn: 结果显示，生长遗留效应的时间模式在多事件层面上动态变化（即同时考虑过去和当前气候条件）：在当前水文年度干旱条件下，可以检测到长达3年的遗留效应；而在当前水文年度湿润条件下，仅能检测到前1年的遗留效应，其强度仅为当前水文年度干旱条件下的57%。此外，我们的结果揭示，树轮中观察到的生长动态与森林覆盖的动态并不完全一致。湿润条件显著增强了生长，而正常到湿润的条件仅勉强维持了森林覆盖的稳定，这表明树木生长对湿润的敏感性高于森林覆盖。此外，连续干旱年对树木径向生长的影响与单一干旱年的影响没有显著差异，但在连续干旱后，森林覆盖的下降加速。

Verification.QuestionEn: Does the representativeness of tree-ring data in the International Tree-Ring Data Bank face challenges due to the selection of sampling sites?
Verification.QuestionCn: 国际树轮数据银行中的树轮数据的代表性是否因采样地点的选择而面临挑战？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in using tree-ring data from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank for assessing regional forest climate sensitivity?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 使用国际树轮数据银行的树轮数据评估区域森林气候敏感性面临的主要挑战是什么？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where can researchers find datasets on tree-ring width indices for studying forest dynamics in response to climate fluctuations?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 研究人员可以在哪里找到树轮宽度指数的数据集，以研究森林动态对气候波动的响应？
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 国际树木年轮数据银行

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What methods are used to match tree-ring width indices with annual water deficit anomalies in the context of studying forest dynamics?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在研究森林动态的背景下，匹配树轮宽度指数与年度水分赤字异常的方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 基于网格的年度水分亏缺异常

Example.QuestionEn: Can you give an example of how datasets can be expanded or refined to improve the understanding of forest dynamics under climate fluctuations?
Example.QuestionCn: 可以给出一个例子，说明如何扩展或精炼数据集，以改善对气候波动下森林动态的理解。
Example.AnswerEn: To refine datasets, integrating more metadata such as tree diameter and microenvironmental information for sampled trees could improve the understanding of forest dynamics. Additionally, matching grid-level climatological data with tree-ring indices can help reduce biases from coarse climate data resolution, thus enhancing the dataset's accuracy in reflecting forest dynamics.
Example.AnswerCn: 为了精炼数据集，整合更多的元数据，如采样树木的树径和微环境信息，可以提高对森林动态的理解。此外，将网格级气候数据与树轮指数匹配，可以帮助减少粗糙气候数据分辨率带来的偏差，从而提高数据集在反映森林动态方面的准确性。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What factors are considered when designing natural experiments for assessing tree growth responses to water deficit conditions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在设计自然实验以评估树木对水分不足条件的生长反应时，需要考虑哪些因素？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: current and antecedent hydrological year conditions, preset criteria for normal, wet, or dry conditions, tree-ring records grouping, superimposed effects of multiple years' climatic conditions
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 当前和前期水文年状况，正常、湿润或干旱条件的预设标准，树轮记录分组，多年气候条件的叠加效应。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many sampling points are used to collect data on tree-ring widths and water deficit anomalies in the specified semi-arid region?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在指定的半干旱地区，收集树轮宽度和水分亏缺异常数据使用了多少个采样点？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'natural experiments' mean in the context of analyzing forest dynamics?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在分析森林动态的背景下，“自然实验”指的是利用自然发生的事件或条件变化来研究森林生态系统的反应和变化。这些事件可能包括气候变化、自然灾害、物种入侵或人类活动等，通过观察这些自然条件下的森林变化，研究人员可以获得关于森林生态过程和动态的重要信息。
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Natural experiments' in this context refer to the designed regional-scaled studies where hypothetical water conditions of current and antecedent hydrological years are preset, allowing for the quantitative analysis of tree-ring records and forest coverage changes under these conditions.
Definition.AnswerCn: “自然实验”在此上下文中指的是设计的区域规模研究，其中当前和先前水文年份的假设水条件被预设，从而允许对树轮记录和在这些条件下的森林覆盖变化进行定量分析。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods of tree-ring width indices from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank compare to the methods used for collecting annual water deficit anomaly data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 国际树轮数据银行的树轮宽度指数的数据收集方法与收集年度水分赤字异常数据的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Tree-ring width indices are collected using standardized procedures from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank, where tree-ring data is standardized using the ARSTAN program to remove age-related trends. In contrast, annual water deficit anomaly data is derived from grid-based meteorological data, which is matched to the tree-ring data to assess the impact of drought conditions on tree growth.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 树轮宽度指数是使用国际树轮数据银行的标准化程序收集的，树轮数据通过ARSTAN程序进行标准化，以去除与年龄相关的趋势。相比之下，年度水分赤字异常数据是从基于网格的气象数据中得出的，这些数据与树轮数据相匹配，以评估干旱条件对树木生长的影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when assessing legacy effects using tree-ring data compared to forest coverage data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在使用树轮数据评估遗留效应时，与使用森林覆盖数据相比，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Tree-ring data faces challenges such as the potential overestimation of regional forest climate sensitivity due to site selection bias in the International Tree-Ring Data Bank, and the need for more metadata to clarify these uncertainties. Conversely, forest coverage data challenges involve analyzing sub-pixel changes and accounting for the impact of inter-annual water deficit on forest dynamics, which may not align with tree-ring growth patterns.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 树轮数据面临挑战，例如由于国际树轮数据银行中的站点选择偏差，可能导致对区域森林气候敏感性的高估，以及需要更多的元数据来澄清这些不确定性。相反，森林覆盖数据的挑战涉及分析亚像素变化和考虑年度水分赤字对森林动态的影响，这可能与树轮生长模式不一致。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the use of standardized tree-ring width indices influence the interpretation of long-term forest dynamics in a semi-arid region?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 标准化树轮宽度指数的使用如何影响对半干旱地区长期森林动态的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of standardized tree-ring width indices helps mitigate the effects of aging and tree diameter increase, allowing researchers to more accurately assess interannual variations in tree growth and their responses to water deficit anomalies, thus providing a clearer understanding of long-term forest dynamics.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用标准化的树轮宽度指数有助于减轻树木老化和树径增加的影响，使研究人员能够更准确地评估树木生长的年际变化及其对水分不足异常的响应，从而更清晰地理解长期森林动态。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges can arise from the use of existing tree-ring data banks in assessing the accuracy of forest climate sensitivity and how might researchers address these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用现有树轮数据银行评估森林气候敏感性时可能出现哪些挑战，以及研究人员如何应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Existing tree-ring data banks may overestimate regional forest climate sensitivity due to selective sampling sites. Researchers can address these challenges by updating metadata such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment information of sampled trees to improve the representativeness and accuracy of the data.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 现有的树轮数据银行可能由于选择性采样地点而高估区域森林气候敏感性。研究人员可以通过更新样本树木的胸径和微环境信息等元数据来解决这些挑战，从而提高数据的代表性和准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What insights can be gained from comparing legacy effects on tree-ring widths versus forest coverage changes, and how might this comparison influence future forest management strategies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 通过比较遗留效应对树轮宽度与森林覆盖变化的影响，可以获得哪些见解，这种比较如何影响未来的森林管理策略？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Comparing legacy effects on tree-ring widths and forest coverage changes reveals that tree growth is more sensitive to wet conditions than forest coverage. This insight could influence future forest management strategies by highlighting the need for targeted interventions during wet periods to enhance tree growth and maintain forest stability.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 比较遗留效应对树轮宽度和森林覆盖变化的影响表明，树木生长对湿润条件的敏感性高于森林覆盖。这一见解可能会影响未来的森林管理策略，强调在湿润时期进行针对性干预以增强树木生长和维持森林稳定的必要性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors might cause variability in tree-ring data from different sampling sites, and how can these be mitigated?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致不同采样地点树轮数据变异的因素有哪些？如何减轻这些因素的影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The representativeness of tree-ring data in the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB) has been questioned due to the specific selection of sampling sites. This variability can be mitigated by updating more metadata, such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment information, of sampled trees in the ITRDB to clarify these uncertainties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）中的树轮数据代表性受到质疑，原因在于采样地点的特定选择。这种变异性可以通过更新更多的元数据来减轻，例如样本树的胸径和微环境信息，以澄清这些不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do legacy effects in tree growth differ under varying hydrological conditions and how does this impact data collection?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么树木生长中的遗留效应在不同水文条件下会有所不同，这对数据收集有什么影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Legacy effects in tree growth differ under varying hydrological conditions because, under current-hydrological year dry conditions, legacy effects over three years can be detected, whereas under wet conditions, only the previous year's legacy can be detected, with reduced intensity. This variance impacts data collection by necessitating the consideration of both past and current water deficit conditions to accurately assess forest dynamics.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 树木生长中的遗留效应在不同的水文条件下有所不同，因为在当前水文年份的干旱条件下，可以检测到三年的遗留效应，而在湿润条件下，仅能检测到前一年的遗留效应，且强度减弱。这种差异影响了数据收集，要求在准确评估森林动态时考虑过去和当前的水分不足条件。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the inclusion of more comprehensive metadata, such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment details, affect the interpretation of tree-ring data in understanding forest climate sensitivity?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 更全面的元数据的纳入，例如胸径和微环境细节，将如何影响树轮数据在理解森林气候敏感性方面的解读。
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Including more comprehensive metadata could help clarify uncertainties regarding the representativeness of tree-ring data, potentially leading to more accurate interpretations of forest climate sensitivity. This could address concerns that current datasets overestimate regional climate sensitivity due to specific site selections.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 包括更全面的元数据可以帮助澄清关于树轮数据代表性的疑虑，从而可能导致对森林气候敏感性的更准确解释。这可以解决当前数据集由于特定地点选择而高估区域气候敏感性的问题。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary goal of examining the temporal dynamics of legacy effects recorded in tree-rings in relation to both past and current water deficit conditions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 研究树轮中记录的遗留效应的时间动态与过去和当前水分不足条件的关系的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary goal is to expand the understanding of forest dynamics in response to climate by examining how legacy effects on tree-ring widths and forest coverage change under different water deficit conditions, and to hypothesize that the response of tree growth to these interannual conditions is rapid and intense compared to forest coverage.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是通过研究遗留效应对树木年轮宽度和森林覆盖率在不同水分不足条件下的变化，来扩展对森林动态在气候变化响应中的理解，并假设树木生长对这些年际条件的响应相较于森林覆盖率是快速而强烈的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to compare the legacy effects on tree-ring widths and forest coverage change?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 比较树轮宽度和森林覆盖变化的遗留效应为何重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to compare these legacy effects to understand the differential responses of tree growth and forest coverage to climate conditions, as tree growth is hypothesized to be more sensitive to wetness than forest coverage, which could lead to a better understanding of forest dynamics at different spatial scales.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 比较这些遗留效应对于理解树木生长和森林覆盖对气候条件的不同响应是重要的，因为树木生长被假设对湿度更敏感，这可能有助于更好地理解不同空间尺度上的森林动态。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended objectives of conducting natural experiments to study the impacts of inter-annual water deficit on forest coverage dynamics?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 进行自然实验以研究年度水分不足对森林覆盖动态影响的预期目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended objectives are to conduct quantitative analysis on grouped tree-ring records and sub-pixel changes of forest coverage under preset hypothetical water conditions, in order to study how different water deficit conditions affect forest coverage dynamics and to understand the ecological impacts of past and current extremes on forest ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期目标是对分组的树轮记录和森林覆盖的亚像素变化进行定量分析，在预设的假设水条件下，研究不同水分不足条件如何影响森林覆盖动态，并理解过去和当前极端情况对森林生态系统的生态影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in standardizing and scaling tree-ring width data to account for aging and diameter growth before analysis?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在分析之前，标准化和缩放树轮宽度数据以考虑年龄和直径生长涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The tree-ring width data is standardized using the ARSTAN program by applying a negative exponential curve to eliminate long-term trends caused by aging and diameter growth. After standardization, all chronologies are scaled to a standard mean with comparable variance (RWI = 1000) to reduce spatial heterogeneity among tree-ring sites.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 树轮宽度数据通过ARSTAN程序进行标准化，采用负指数曲线消除因树木老化和直径生长引起的长期趋势。标准化后，所有年轮序列被缩放到一个标准均值，具有可比的方差（RWI = 1000），以减少树轮站点之间的空间异质性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the matching of grid-based water deficit anomaly data with tree-ring width indices achieved to minimize biases due to coarse climate data resolution?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何将基于网格的水分赤字异常数据与树轮宽度指数匹配，以最小化由于气候数据分辨率粗糙而导致的偏差？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Grid-based annual water deficit anomaly data is matched with tree-ring width indices by averaging tree-ring records within the same grid annually. This approach helps to reduce biases that may arise from the coarse spatial resolution of climate data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 基于网格的年度水分赤字异常数据与树轮宽度指数相匹配，通过在相同网格内按年度平均树轮记录。这种方法有助于减少气候数据粗糙空间分辨率可能带来的偏差。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodological approach is used to design regional-scaled 'natural experiments' to assess the impact of inter-annual water deficit on forest coverage dynamics?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于设计区域规模的“自然实验”以评估年际水分不足对森林覆盖动态影响的方法论是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Regional-scaled 'natural experiments' are designed by setting hypothetical water conditions for current and antecedent hydrological years, and conducting quantitative analysis on grouped tree-ring records and sub-pixel changes in forest coverage under these conditions. Forest coverage change (FCC) data is grouped according to selection criteria for water deficit conditions (normal, wet, or dry) to facilitate comparative analysis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 区域尺度的“自然实验”通过设定当前和前期水文年份的假设水条件来设计，并对分组的树轮记录和森林覆盖率的亚像素变化进行定量分析。森林覆盖变化（FCC）数据根据水分亏缺条件（正常、湿润或干旱）的选择标准进行分组，以便进行比较分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions might enable the refinement of metadata in datasets derived from tree-ring data banks to address uncertainties in forest climate sensitivity?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件可能使得从树轮数据银行衍生的数据集中的元数据得到改进，以解决森林气候敏感性中的不确定性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Updating metadata with information such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment conditions of sampled trees could help clarify uncertainties related to the representativeness of tree-ring data in the International Tree-Ring Data Bank.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 更新元数据，包括样本树的胸径和微环境条件，可以帮助澄清与国际树轮数据银行中树轮数据代表性相关的不确定性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the application of 'natural experiments' enhance the understanding of legacy effects on tree growth and forest coverage?
Enablement.QuestionCn: “自然实验”的应用如何增强对树木生长和森林覆盖遗留效应的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Designing regional-scaled 'natural experiments' allows for the analysis of tree-ring records and forest coverage changes under predefined hypothetical water conditions, thereby enhancing the understanding of legacy effects under different hydrological scenarios.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 设计区域规模的“自然实验”可以在预定义的假设水文条件下分析树轮记录和森林覆盖变化，从而增强对不同水文情景下遗留效应的理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the integration of tree-ring width data with grid-based water deficit anomalies to investigate the impact on radial growth?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以将树轮宽度数据与基于网格的水分赤字异常集成，以研究其对径向生长的影响？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Matching grid-based annual water deficit anomalies with tree-ring width indices and averaging these within the same grid to reduce bias from coarse climate data resolution enables the investigation of impacts on radial growth.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 将基于网格的年度水分赤字异常与树轮宽度指数进行匹配，并在相同网格内进行平均，以减少粗糙气候数据分辨率带来的偏差，从而能够研究对径向生长的影响。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the anticipated impact of water deficit conditions on forest coverage dynamics differ from that on tree growth dynamics in data analysis?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 水分不足条件对森林覆盖动态的预期影响可能与对树木生长动态的影响在数据分析中有所不同，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The findings indicate that tree growth shows a more pronounced response to wetness, whereas forest coverage remains relatively stable under normal to wet conditions. This suggests that tree growth is more sensitive to changes in moisture levels compared to forest coverage.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 研究结果表明，树木生长对湿度的反应更为明显，而森林覆盖率在正常到湿润的条件下保持相对稳定。这表明，树木生长对水分变化的敏感性高于森林覆盖率。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What could be the reasons for the anticipated sensitivity of tree-ring data to regional climate, potentially leading to overestimations in datasets?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 树轮数据对区域气候的敏感性预期可能导致数据集的高估，原因可能包括以下几点：
Expectation.AnswerEn: The representativeness of tree-ring data in the ITRDB has been questioned due to the specific selection of sampling sites, which may lead to overestimations of regional forest climate sensitivity.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 国际树轮数据库（ITRDB）中的树轮数据的代表性受到质疑，因为采样地点的特定选择可能导致对区域森林气候敏感性的高估。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might current water conditions immediately influence tree growth more significantly than past extreme events, according to dataset analysis expectations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 根据数据集分析的预期，当前的水条件可能比过去的极端事件更显著地影响树木生长，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current water conditions have a direct and immediate impact on tree growth, potentially altering or offsetting the ecological impacts of past extremes. This is because current growth conditions are rapidly and intensely responsive to changes in interannual water deficit conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前的水分条件对树木生长有直接和即时的影响，可能会改变或抵消过去极端情况的生态影响。这是因为当前的生长条件对年际水分赤字条件的变化反应迅速而强烈。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might the representativeness of tree-ring data from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank be improved to better reflect regional climate sensitivity?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何提高国际树轮数据银行的树轮数据的代表性，以更好地反映区域气候敏感性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The representativeness of tree-ring data in the ITRDB has been questioned due to specific selection of sampling sites. Updating more metadata, such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment information, of sampled trees can help clarify these uncertainties.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 国际树轮数据库（ITRDB）中的树轮数据的代表性受到质疑，原因是采样地点的特定选择。更新更多的元数据，例如胸径和微环境信息，可以帮助澄清这些不确定性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could spatial heterogeneity be accounted for when scaling up tree-ring data to study forest dynamics over larger regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在将树轮数据扩展到研究更大区域的森林动态时，可以通过哪些方式考虑空间异质性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: To account for spatial heterogeneity, standard mean scaling of tree-ring chronologies to comparable variance could be employed. Additionally, averaging tree-ring indices within grid cells and designing regional-scale natural experiments can help understand the legacy effects on forest coverage dynamics.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 为了考虑空间异质性，可以采用标准均值缩放树轮年表以实现可比方差。此外，在网格单元内平均树轮指数以及设计区域尺度的自然实验可以帮助理解森林覆盖动态的遗留效应。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure why there is a need for standardizing tree-ring data and what methodology is used for it.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定为什么需要对树轮数据进行标准化，以及使用什么方法。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Standardizing tree-ring data is crucial to eliminate long-term trends caused by aging and diameter growth, allowing for a more accurate analysis of climate effects on growth. The ARSTAN program is used, which applies a negative exponential curve to transform tree-ring width data into ring-width indices (RWI), helping to reduce spatial heterogeneity among different sites.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 标准化树轮数据对于消除因树木老化和直径生长引起的长期趋势至关重要，这样可以更准确地分析气候对生长的影响。ARSTAN程序被用来应用负指数曲线，将树轮宽度数据转化为年轮宽度指数（RWI），帮助减少不同地点之间的空间异质性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of why the representativeness of tree-ring data is questioned.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解为什么树轮数据的代表性受到质疑。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The representativeness of tree-ring data is questioned because specific sampling sites may lead to an overestimation of regional forest climate sensitivity. To address these uncertainties, it is suggested to update metadata with details like the tree's diameter at breast height and microenvironment information, which could provide a clearer context for interpreting the data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 树轮数据的代表性受到质疑，因为特定的采样地点可能导致对区域森林气候敏感性的高估。为了解决这些不确定性，建议更新元数据，增加树木胸径和微环境信息等细节，这可以为解释数据提供更清晰的背景。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the potential challenges that may arise when relying on tree-ring data from the International Tree-Ring Data Bank in assessing forest dynamics.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在依赖国际树轮数据银行的树轮数据评估森林动态时可能出现的潜在挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The representativeness of tree-ring data in the International Tree-Ring Data Bank (ITRDB) has been questioned due to the specific selection of sampling sites, which may lead to an overestimation of regional forest climate sensitivity. Updating metadata such as diameter at breast height and microenvironment information of sampled trees can help address these uncertainties.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 国际树轮数据银行（ITRDB）中的树轮数据代表性受到质疑，原因在于采样地点的特定选择可能导致区域森林气候敏感性的高估。更新样本树木的胸径和微环境信息等元数据可以帮助解决这些不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the methodologies used for matching grid-based water deficit anomaly data with tree-ring width indices and analyze the impact of spatial heterogeneity on this matching process.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于将基于网格的水分亏损异常数据与树轮宽度指数匹配的方法，并分析空间异质性对这一匹配过程的影响。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Grid-based water deficit anomaly (Dya) data were matched with tree-ring width indices (RWI) by averaging tree-ring data within the same grid to reduce bias from coarse climate data resolution. The spatial heterogeneity among tree-ring sites was minimized by standardizing all chronologies to a comparable variance (RWI = 1000).
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 网格化水分赤字异常（Dya）数据与树轮宽度指数（RWI）匹配，通过在相同网格内平均树轮数据来减少粗糙气候数据分辨率带来的偏差。通过将所有年轮序列标准化为可比较的方差（RWI = 1000），最小化了树轮站点之间的空间异质性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please examine the techniques applied to study the impacts of inter-annual water deficit on forest coverage dynamics and discuss how these techniques account for different hydrological year conditions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请检查用于研究年际水分不足对森林覆盖动态影响的技术，并讨论这些技术如何考虑不同水文年条件。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The study employed regional-scaled 'natural experiments' and grouped tree-ring records and forest coverage data based on preset water deficit conditions (normal, wet, or dry) of current and antecedent hydrological years. Forest coverage change (FCC) data were analyzed under these conditions to study inter-annual water deficit impacts on forest dynamics.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 该研究采用了区域规模的“自然实验”，并根据当前和前期水文年的预设水分赤字条件（正常、湿润或干旱）对树木年轮记录和森林覆盖数据进行了分组。在这些条件下，分析了森林覆盖变化（FCC）数据，以研究年际水分赤字对森林动态的影响。
